recipe:item.NXkkUWRu: {"id":"NXkkUWRu","lastModified":"2016-02-05T02:24:58.033798Z","names":["Hyderabadi Bagara Baingan","Eggplant in a Peanut-Sesame Gravy"],"description":"Fried eggplant in a rich peanut and sesame gravy, a legacy of the Nizam rule of Hyderabad in India","steps":[{"text":"To prepare the eggplants","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"If using small baby eggplants, leaving the stem intact, make 5 slits (like *) along the length of the eggplant. It is important that the eggplant is held together at the stem","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Otherwise, simply cut into large cubes","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Deep fry in hot oil, drain on kitchen towels and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Use a {deep fryer} if you want to. A deep saucepan will do just as well","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"To make the gravy","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Cook the tamarind with ┬¢ cup of water in the {microwave} on high for 30 seconds. Cool and squeeze out the tamarind juice. Discard the seeds and fibre and set the juice aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Roast the peanuts, sesame seeds, khus-khus (poppy seeds) and dry coconut until everything starts to brown","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Grind along with the green chillies. Add up to 1 cup of water in small amounts to facilitate grinding and make a smooth paste","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Use a {spice mill}, {Indian mixie grinder} or {magic bullet} or something similar. Regular blenders are too large, so they will just toss the contents around instead of grinding them","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"In a saucepan, heat 3 tbsp of oil. Add fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, curry leaves and a pinch of asafoetida and fry till the mustard seeds splutter","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin powder and turmeric and saute for a minute","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the ground peanut-sesame paste and fry until you can see oil starting to separate from the mixture. Keep stirring and don't let anything stick to the pan","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the tamarind juice and 2 cups of water, season with salt and bring to a boil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Bring down to a simmer, add the fried eggplant and cook covered for 5 minutes","decorator":"Text"}],"totalTimeInMinutes":60,"servings":"Serves 7-8","approved":true,"spiceLevel":"Hot","region":"Indian Subcontinent","chefId":"auth0|5710de6b3c7ae40538abdc35","imageId":"QjWTNJiJ","ingredients":[{"text":"500 g eggplants, use whole baby eggplants or alternatively cut into large chunks","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"oil, for deep frying","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"For the gravy","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"┬¢ cup peanuts","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬╝ cup sesame seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tbsp white poppy seeds or khus-khus, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¥ cup dried coconut, shredded, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"5-6 green chillies (adjust based on your spice/heat tolerance)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"20 g tamarind","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"3 tbsp oil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tsp turmeric powder","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tbsp ground coriander","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tsp ground cumin","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste or ┬¢ tbsp ginger, crushed and ┬¢ tbsp garlic, crushed","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1┬¢ tsp mustard seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¢ tsp fenugreek seeds, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"10-12 curry leaves","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"a pinch of asafoetida (hing)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Salt, to taste","decorator":"Text"}],"cuisine":"South Indian","ingredientIds":["N2YXf2ns","NjTiracx","bVx2xwma","7lZzLbgx","jnZf_ewk","Mqf6ueTW","pkodzwcN","1Af_VldR","-GB41Pde","DfgIn-bx","_hfTfh3z","gekWvr9Y","4qfpoFAN","hr8-r0DU","nbfmHKxW","uB6jpbJQ","w6QRWRBb","b6ldX3JK","JKsRsdaq"],"overnightPreparation":false,"collections":["Curries","Side dishes"],"vegan":true}
recipe:item.3uDSc4Vg: {"id":"3uDSc4Vg","lastModified":"2016-02-05T02:25:54.6419062Z","names":["Hyderabadi Vegetable Dum Biryani","Slow-Cooked Spiced Vegetables and Rice"],"description":"A slow-cooked fragrant and spicy rice dish, a legacy of the Nizam rule in Hyderabad in India","steps":[{"text":"Warm ┬¢ cup of milk, add the saffron strands and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Fry the raisins and cashews in 3 tbsp of ghee and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"To cook the rice","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Mix the salt, oil and shahi jeera (black cumin seeds) in 6 cups of water in a large pot and bring to a boil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the rice and cook until just done. The rice should be slightly undercooked","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Drain well, spread the rice on a large tray and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"To make the vegetable mixture","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Cook the vegetables (covered) with ┬¢ cup of water in the {microwave} on high for 12 minutes. Drain and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Dry roast bay leaves, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, pepper and cumin seeds for 2 minutes or until they become strongly aromatic. Grind to a fine powder and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Heat the ┬¢ cup of oil in a large saucepan. Add shahi jeera (black cumin seeds), ginger-garlic paste and green chillies. Saute for a minute","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the ground spice mixture, ground nutmeg, lemon juice, salt and all the vegetables. Cook for 5 minutes to allow the vegetables to absorb some of the flavours","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Mix in kasoori methi (dried fenugreek leaves), turn off the heat and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"To slow-cook the rice and vegetables together","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Use a large pot with a heavy lid","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Spread half of the vegetable mixture on the bottom of the pot. Top with a layer of ┬¢ cup of yoghurt. ","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Spread half of the chopped mint leaves and fresh coriander, followed by half of the rice. Sprinkle half of the saffron-milk mixture over the rice","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Spread half of the fried raisins and cashews along with some ghee on top","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Repeat this process with the remaining halves of all the mixtures in the same order starting with the vegetables and ending with the cashews and raisins","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Cover and place the pot on a low flame and cook for ┬¢ hour","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"If the lid is not heavy enough and you can see steam escaping the pot, you can also wrap it with a damp cloth","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"If you are worried about the vegetable mixture sticking to the bottom of the pot and burning, place the pot in a shallow pan that is wider than the pot. Fill the pan with 1 cup of water and place the whole assembly on the stove. Nothing will burn, promise!","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"Serve hot with {Hyderabadi Bagara Baingan}","decorator":"Text"}],"totalTimeInMinutes":90,"servings":"Serves 7-8","approved":true,"spiceLevel":"Hot","region":"Indian Subcontinent","chefId":"auth0|5710de6b3c7ae40538abdc35","imageId":"ip8GhIId","ingredients":[{"text":"For the rice","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"3 cups long-grain rice, soaked for at least 30 min","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"6 cups water","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tsp black cumin seeds (shahi jeera)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tbsp oil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tsp salt","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"For the vegetable mixture","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"2 bay leaves","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"4 green cardamom","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"8 cloves","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2\" piece of cinnamon","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"6 black peppercorns or 1┬¢ tsp ground black pepper","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1┬¢ tsp cumin seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬╝ tsp ground nutmeg","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¢ cup oil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste or 1 tbsp ginger, crushed and 1 tbsp garlic, crushed","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tsp shahi jeera or caraway seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"8-10 green chillies, cut into large pieces (adjust based on your spice/heat tolerance)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"100 g green beans, cut into 1\" pieces","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"300 g carrots, cut into large cubes","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"300 g potatoes, cut into large cubes","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"200 g cauliflower, cut into large florets, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 cup green peas","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tbsp dried fenugreek leaves (kasoori methi)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tbsp lemon juice, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Salt, to taste","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 cup yoghurt, whisked till smooth","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 cups fresh mint leaves, chopped","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 cup fresh coriander, chopped","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"For the garnish","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"a fat pinch of saffron strands, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¢ cup milk, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"3 tbsp ghee, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¢ cup raisins or sultanas, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 cup cashews, optional","decorator":"Text"}],"cuisine":"South Indian","ingredientIds":["g-KVLn0I","kxHIX-LZ","Q-k77C0c","NjTiracx","JKsRsdaq","slR9aCV6","HILBuSz_","c0STLmcq","IHF1u5S4","TobAHlmq","pUdoIzXE","_hfTfh3z","bNGLFPl0","uB6jpbJQ","w6QRWRBb","pkodzwcN","ze-Wjp1J","QBFdQgP0","bsSuyXu6","-6US1xKg","GW_XXZqX","fvr4vmad","u2teMhEi","AqWMlkGo","zNkkWf5S","Sn49NAnC","vXTpWf8f","wwlVWpHS","b6ldX3JK"],"overnightPreparation":false,"accompanimentIds":["NXkkUWRu"],"collections":["Dinner","Lunch","Main course","One-pot meals","Rice dishes"],"vegan":false}

ingredient:item.7lZzLbgx: {"id":"7lZzLbgx","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:15:10.698Z","names":["Sesame Seeds","White Sesame Seeds"],"description":"Refers to the white seeds, unless specified otherwise. The seeds have a nutty flavour and are best when toasted before use. Commonly used in Indian, Asian and Middle-Eastern cuisine or sprinkled on baked goods. \n\nBuy from local supermarkets or get them for less in Asian, Indian or Middle-Eastern grocery stores. Store in an airtight container in a cool, dark place.","category":"Legumes, Nuts and Seeds","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.hr8-r0DU: {"id":"hr8-r0DU","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:10:51.753Z","names":["Curry Leaves","Kari Patta","Sweet Neem Leaves"],"description":"Used mainly in the Indian subcontinent, these leaves are used as seasoning. They are generally fried in hot oil, although they can be ground up or dried and powdered as well. \n\nPick the leaves from the stalks and store in a freezer bag for months.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.4qfpoFAN: {"id":"4qfpoFAN","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:11:40.46Z","names":["Fenugreek Seeds","Methi Dana"],"description":"Small, yellow-brown coloured, with a strong bitter taste, these seeds are added to curries, chutneys, stews and sauces. You can find them in Indian or Middle-Eastern grocery stores as seeds or powder. You can also make the powder at home by simply toasting the seeds and grinding them. \n\nBoth the seeds and powder store well in the pantry, although the powder loses its potency quickly.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.N2YXf2ns: {"id":"N2YXf2ns","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:11:26.651Z","names":["Aubergine","Brinjal","Eggplant"],"description":"There are several varieties available, so buy based on the recipe. Bake, grill, fry, or saute them, but never eat them raw. Buy firm, fresh ones, with a shiny skin. Store them in the refrigerator for a few days. They will become soft and wrinkly quickly, so use as soon as you can. \n\nEggplants can sometimes be bitter, so some recipes call for peeling and salting the eggplant before cooking. ","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.Mqf6ueTW: {"id":"Mqf6ueTW","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:11:10.305Z","names":["Dried Coconut"],"description":"Dried coconut is sold as halves, grated or flaked. You can buy halves at grate them yourself. It is used in both sweet and savoury dishes and is an important ingredient in South Indian, Sri Lankan and Southeast Asian cuisines.\n\nDried coconut stores well in the pantry or refrigerator, but use within a few months","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.JKsRsdaq: {"id":"JKsRsdaq","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:14:58.871Z","names":["Salt"],"description":"Most recipes call for table salt, although there are several varieties - sea salt, kosher salt, rock salt and so on. In general, it doesn't matter which you use, unless the recipe specially needs a particular type.\n\nSalt can absorb moisture very quickly. Most table salt contains an anti-caking agent that prevents this, but it is best to store salt in airtight containers away from moisture. ","category":"Condiments and Flavourings","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.jnZf_ewk: {"id":"jnZf_ewk","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:16:28.421Z","names":["Kas-Kas","Khus-Khus","White Poppy Seeds"],"description":"Used in both sweet and savoury Indian dishes, white poppy seeds can be a thickening agent or a source of crunch. \n\nBuy from Indian grocery stores. They will last for several months or more when stored in an airtight container in the pantry. There is no need to refrigerate, but there is no harm either. ","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.kxHIX-LZ: {"id":"kxHIX-LZ","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:09:13.062Z","names":["Black Cumin Seeds","Royal Cumin Seeds","Shah Jeera","Shahi Jeera"],"description":"Used mainly in North Indian cuisine, this spice is thinner, darker and sweeter than cumin seeds. You can find them in most Indian grocery stores. \n\nBuy in small amounts and store in a cool, dark place in a sealed container. To bring out the flavour of slightly old seeds, simply toast them until they are aromatic","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.g-KVLn0I: {"id":"g-KVLn0I","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:13:17.299Z","names":["Long-Grain Rice"],"description":"As the name suggests, this rice is long. When cooked, it is generally fluffy and the grains stay separate. Examples include Basmati rice and Jasmine rice.\n\nStore rice in a cool, dry place. It will last for months, even years. ","category":"Grains, Grain Products and Flours","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.b6ldX3JK: {"id":"b6ldX3JK","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:15.051Z","names":["Garlic"],"description":"The most common garlic is white-skinned and quite pungent. There are other varieties - mild green or purple-skinned. Buy raw and whole, unless there is a specific need for other types.  \n\nStore in a dry, cool place in your pantry and it will last for several weeks. There is no need to refrigerate garlic. ","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.-6US1xKg:
{"id":"-6US1xKg","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:10:08.835Z","names":["Cauliflower"],"description":"Use them raw as crudites, or make curries, soups, casseroles, fritters and more with this delicious vegetable. 

Buy fresh, heavy one with clean white surfaces. Generally, the green parts are discarded.

Unless you are making soups, always cut into florets instead of just chopping them up. They will look and cook better. Wash thoroughly before use. The best way is to put the florets in a large bowl with 1 cup of water and half a teaspoon of salt, cover with cling wrap and microwave for 2 minutes. Drain the water.

Store whole cauliflowers wrapped in plastic in the refrigerator for up to a week. You can also cut into florets and store in an airtight container. The florets can also be frozen but be sure to thaw them out in the refrigerator before use","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.GW_XXZqX: {"id":"GW_XXZqX","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:34.34Z","names":["Fresh Peas","Garden Peas","Green Peas","Shell Peas"],"description":"You can buy them whole with their pods and shell them yourself. You can also buy them shelled, either fresh or frozen. You can also buy fresh and freeze the peas yourself. Remember that frozen peas cook a lot faster than fresh ones. \n\nRecipe measurements usually refer to the shelled peas, not the whole pods.","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.NjTiracx: {"id":"NjTiracx","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:13:46.1Z","names":["Oil"],"description":"Refers to any cooking oil, preferably one without a strong flavour. If using it for deep-frying, choose an oil that doesn't smoke too easily. \n\nStore oil in a cool, dark and dry place. Most commonly used oils store very well for several months, sometimes more than a year.","category":"Oils and Sweeteners","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.DfgIn-bx: {"id":"DfgIn-bx","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:10:34.395Z","names":["Coriander Seeds","Dhania"],"description":"These are small, almost spherical, light brown seeds that are used in several cuisines around the world. Generally sold as whole seeds or in powdered form. Coriander seeds can be freshly ground at home for better flavour. Simply toast them and grind to a fine powder.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.nbfmHKxW: {"id":"nbfmHKxW","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:49.023Z","names":["Asafoetida","Hing"],"description":"This is a gum resin, that is sold as tiny dried pieces or more commonly in powdered form, which is slightly milder. It is used primarily in Indian dishes and imparts a unique flavour. Use very sparingly as it can completely overwhelm every other flavour.\n\nYou can find it in Indian grocery stores in small plastic bottles. Store covered or it will lose its potency. There is no need to refrigerate. ","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.pkodzwcN:
{"id":"pkodzwcN","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:32.169Z","names":["Green Chillies"],"description":"There are several varieties of chillies around the world which vary in colour and intensity. Use small thai green chillies or thin and long green chillies. In general, the smaller or thinner the chilli, the hotter it will be. Remove seeds if you want less heat. 

Although a lot of recipes will ask for specific chillies, you can always interchange them with no big difference. But always make sure you use chillies with similar intensity.

Be careful while handling chillies. The really hot ones can sting your skin. Use gloves if you can. Rub sugar between your hands to remove the sting. 

Fresh, shiny, bright green chillies from the market can be stored in the refrigerator for 2 weeks. You can also store them in the freezer in small bags. Thaw them before use or simply grate the frozen chillies onto food for extra heat.","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.AqWMlkGo: {"id":"AqWMlkGo","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:01.164Z","names":["Fresh Mint","Mint Leaves","Pudina"],"description":"Used in cuisines around the world to bring freshness to dishes. They are generally added towards the end of the cooking process or even after. \n\nSold in bunches in most markets, they spoil very quickly. Store in the refrigerator, wrapped in paper towels and use within a few days. They will last longer if you pick the leaves and store in a container lined with paper towels. You can also crush them with some oil and freeze in ice trays for later use.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.bNGLFPl0: {"id":"bNGLFPl0","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:13:45.027Z","names":["Nutmeg"],"description":"Usually used in powdered form, you can also buy whole nutmegs and grate them just before use. \n\nUsed in several cuisines, you can buy them in Indian, Middle-Eastern or Asian stores as well as local supermarkets. Store them in a cool, dry place. Use an airtight container if you buy the powdered form. ","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.Q-k77C0c: {"id":"Q-k77C0c","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:13:30.654Z","names":["Milk"],"description":"Refers to full cream milk, unless otherwise specified. Buy from supermarkets and store in the refrigerator and use before its use by date.","category":"Dairy, Eggs and Non-dairy Cheeses","vegan":false}
ingredient:item.zNkkWf5S: {"id":"zNkkWf5S","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:11:54.258Z","names":["Cilantro","Fresh Coriander"],"description":"Used in cuisines around the world to bring freshness to dishes. They are generally added towards the end of the cooking process or even after. \n\nSold in bunches in most markets, they spoil very quickly. Store in the refrigerator, wrapped in paper towels and use within a few days. They will last longer if you pick the leaves and store in a container lined with paper towels. You can also crush them with some oil and freeze in ice trays for later use.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.vXTpWf8f: {"id":"vXTpWf8f","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:15:47.529Z","names":["Golden Raisins","Sultanas"],"description":"Refers to any kind of dried grape including golden raisins, dark raisins or currants.\n\nBuy from local supermarkets and store them in the refrigerator. They will last for several months.","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.TobAHlmq: {"id":"TobAHlmq","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:10:20.493Z","names":["Cinnamon"],"description":"A very popular spice that is used in both sweet and savoury dishes. You can buy whole sticks or ground cinnamon. Either way they last for months in the pantry. Buy small quantities as most recipes call for just a teaspoon or two.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.ze-Wjp1J: {"id":"ze-Wjp1J","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:23.89Z","names":["Green Beans","Snap Beans","String Beans"],"description":"These are beans that are eaten with the enclosing pods. They can be steamed, boiled or stir-fried until tender. Some pods may have strings along the length that you will have to remove before cooking. \n\nBuy fresh, bright green beans from local markets. Store them in the refrigerator for up to a week or you can freeze them either whole or cut into 1\" lengths. ","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.w6QRWRBb: {"id":"w6QRWRBb","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:18.019Z","names":["Adrak","Fresh Ginger","Ginger","Gingerroot","Khing","Shoga"],"description":"Ginger is a common ingredient in several cuisines. Buy raw and fresh ginger, unless you specifically need other types. Always wash and peel before use.\n\nStore unpeeled in a dry, cool place in your pantry if using within the week. Otherwise, store in a plastic bag in the refrigerator for a few weeks to a month ","category":"Vegetables and Fruits","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.u2teMhEi:
{"id":"u2teMhEi","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:16:44.72Z","names":["Curd","Curds","Yoghurt","Yogurt"],"description":"Yoghurt is made using milk and bacterial cultures that make it thick and tangy. Buy ready made from supermarkets. You can get plain or flavoured ones. 

It is, however, very easy and cheap to make yoghurt yourself. You will need a small amount of yoghurt that contains active cultures. Look for yoghurt in the supermarket that specifically mentions these cultures. 

You can use homemade yoghurt as the culture the next time you want to make more. Store it in the refrigerator or it will go sour. Use within a few days. 
","category":"Dairy, Eggs and Non-dairy Cheeses","vegan":false}
ingredient:item.bVx2xwma: {"id":"bVx2xwma","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:14:06.18Z","names":["Groundnuts","Peanuts"],"description":"These are extremely popular and cheap and can be bought shelled or unshelled. Unshelled peanuts are boiled in salted water or toasted and eaten as a snack. \n\nMost recipes use shelled peanuts. They can be bought in supermarkets raw or roasted, salted or unsalted. If you need crushed or ground peanuts for your dish, make sure you toast them first. ","category":"Legumes, Nuts and Seeds","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.fvr4vmad: {"id":"fvr4vmad","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:11:11.394Z","names":["Dried Fenugreek Leaves","Kasoori Methi"],"description":"These leaves are used in Indian cooking mainly to enhance the flavour and aroma of curries. Buy from Indian grocery stores in small amounts. Can store in an airtight container for months. You can make your own by sun-drying fresh fenugreek leaves. ","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.IHF1u5S4: {"id":"IHF1u5S4","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:10:24.944Z","names":["Cloves"],"description":"These are dark brown, flower buds shaped like nails. They have a sweet flavour, but can become quite overpowering if used in excess. Use them to spice up sauces, curries and fragrant rice dishes\n\nThey are available in most grocery stores. Buy small amounts and store in the pantry in a cool, dark place.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.pUdoIzXE: {"id":"pUdoIzXE","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:09:21.851Z","names":["Black Pepper","Black Peppercorns"],"description":"Although whole peppercorns are used in some dishes for the spice, it is more common to grind them before use. You can buy ground black pepper, but it is ridiculously easy to grind whole peppercorns yourself. Ground pepper is also frequently used as seasoning\n","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.HILBuSz_: {"id":"HILBuSz_","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:09:00.829Z","names":["Bay Leaf","Indian Bay Leaf"],"description":"Can be used fresh or dried, they give a woodsy flavour. Generally added whole, these leaves should be removed before serving the dish and discarded\n\nBuy dried leaves if you don't use them too often. You can buy them in supermarkets or maybe get them for less in Indian grocery stores","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.uB6jpbJQ: {"id":"uB6jpbJQ","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:12:22.838Z","names":["Ginger-Garlic Paste"],"description":"A simple blend of ginger and garlic, this paste is used predominantly in Indian cuisine. Sold in jars in Indian grocery stores, but you can make your own. Blend together equal amounts of ginger and garlic. You can use salt, vinegar or oil to make the blending easier. Never use water.\n\nStore in an airtight jar in the refrigerator. It will last for months, but slowly lose its potency. ","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
ingredient:item.wwlVWpHS: {"id":"wwlVWpHS","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:10:04.4Z","names":["Cashewnuts","Cashews"],"description":"These nuts are rich and sweet and have a lovely crunchy texture. Eat them raw, toasted, salted or coated in caramel. Use them to make dips, add crunch in salads and stir-fries or even grind them up for smooth creamy curries.\n\nCashews are generally quite expensive in regular supermarkets. Look for them in ","category":"Legumes, Nuts and Seeds","vegan":true}
ingredient:item._hfTfh3z: {"id":"_hfTfh3z","lastModified":"2016-05-07T08:10:48.818Z","names":["Cumin Seeds","Cummin","Jeera"],"description":"These are small, oblong, ridged, brown seeds that are used in several cuisines around the world. Generally sold as whole seeds or in powdered form. Cumin seeds can be freshly ground at home for better flavour. Simply toast them and grind to a fine powder.","category":"Herbs and Spices","vegan":true}
